001package com.telos.loops.transactional;
002
003import com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException;
004import com.telos.loops.internal.CoreSender;
005import com.telos.loops.internal.mappers.TransactionalMapper;
006import com.telos.loops.model.RequestOptions;
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.Map;
009import java.util.Objects;
010import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
011
012/**
013 * Client for sending and managing transactional emails in Loops.
014 *
015 * <p>This client provides operations for sending one-off transactional emails (e.g., password
016 * resets, order confirmations) and listing sent transactional emails. Transactional emails support
017 * idempotency keys to prevent duplicate sends.
018 *
019 * <h2>Example Usage</h2>
020 *
021 * <pre>{@code
022 * LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
023 *         .apiKey("your-api-key")
024 *         .build();
025 *
026 * // Send a transactional email
027 * Map<String, Object> dataVariables = new HashMap<>();
028 * dataVariables.put("resetLink", "https://example.com/reset/token123");
029 * dataVariables.put("userName", "John");
030 *
031 * TransactionalSendRequest request = new TransactionalSendRequest(
032 *     "user@example.com",  // email
033 *     "clt1234abcd",  // transactionalId (from Loops dashboard)
034 *     null,  // addToAudience (optional)
035 *     dataVariables  // email template variables
036 * );
037 *
038 * TransactionalResponse response = client.transactional().send(request);
039 *
040 * // Send with idempotency key to prevent duplicate sends
041 * String idempotencyKey = "password-reset-user123";
042 * client.transactional().send(request, idempotencyKey);
043 *
044 * // List sent transactional emails (with pagination)
045 * TransactionalListResponse listResponse = client.transactional().list(25, null);
046 * System.out.println("Sent emails: " + listResponse.transactionalEmails().size());
047 *
048 * // Get next page using cursor
049 * String nextCursor = listResponse.cursor();
050 * if (nextCursor != null) {
051 *     TransactionalListResponse nextPage = client.transactional().list(25, nextCursor);
052 * }
053 *
054 * // Async example
055 * CompletableFuture<TransactionalResponse> future =
056 *     client.transactional().sendAsync(request, idempotencyKey);
057 * }</pre>
058 *
059 * <p>All methods are available in both synchronous and asynchronous (CompletableFuture) variants.
060 *
061 * @see com.telos.loops.LoopsClient
062 */
063public class TransactionalClient {
064  private static final String TRANSACTIONAL_PATH = "/transactional";
065  private static final int MAX_IDEMPOTENCY_KEY_LENGTH = 100;
066  private static final int MIN_PER_PAGE = 10;
067  private static final int MAX_PER_PAGE = 50;
068  private final CoreSender sender;
069
070  public TransactionalClient(CoreSender sender) {
071    this.sender = Objects.requireNonNull(sender);
072  }
073
074  // ============================================================
075  // Send Operations
076  // ============================================================
077
078  /**
079   * Sends a transactional email.
080   *
081   * <p>This method uses default request options and no idempotency key.
082   *
083   * @param request the request object containing email details and template variables
084   * @return the response containing the email submission status
085   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
086   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation
087   * @see #sendAsync(TransactionalSendRequest) for the asynchronous variant
088   */
089  public TransactionalResponse send(TransactionalSendRequest request) {
090    return send(request, null, RequestOptions.none());
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Sends a transactional email with an idempotency key.
095   *
096   * <p>The idempotency key ensures that duplicate emails are not sent if the same key is used
097   * within a certain time window.
098   *
099   * @param request the request object containing email details and template variables
100   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate sends
101   * @return the response containing the email submission status
102   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
103   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation or
104   *     idempotency key exceeds 100 characters
105   * @see #sendAsync(TransactionalSendRequest, String) for the asynchronous variant
106   */
107  public TransactionalResponse send(TransactionalSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey) {
108    return send(request, idempotencyKey, RequestOptions.none());
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Sends a transactional email with an idempotency key and custom request options.
113   *
114   * @param request the request object containing email details and template variables
115   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate sends
116   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
117   * @return the response containing the email submission status
118   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
119   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if the request fails validation or
120   *     idempotency key exceeds 100 characters
121   * @see #sendAsync(TransactionalSendRequest, String, RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
122   */
123  public TransactionalResponse send(
124      TransactionalSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey, RequestOptions options) {
125    validateIdempotencyKey(idempotencyKey);
126
127    var generatedRequest = TransactionalMapper.toGenerated(request);
128    var optionsWithIdempotency = addIdempotencyKey(options, idempotencyKey);
129
130    var generatedResponse =
131        sender.postJson(
132            TRANSACTIONAL_PATH,
133            generatedRequest,
134            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.TransactionalSuccessResponse.class,
135            optionsWithIdempotency);
136    return TransactionalMapper.fromGenerated(generatedResponse);
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Asynchronously sends a transactional email.
141   *
142   * <p>This method uses default request options and no idempotency key.
143   *
144   * @param request the request object containing email details and template variables
145   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the email submission status
146   * @see #send(TransactionalSendRequest) for the synchronous variant
147   */
148  public CompletableFuture<TransactionalResponse> sendAsync(TransactionalSendRequest request) {
149    return sendAsync(request, null, RequestOptions.none());
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Asynchronously sends a transactional email with an idempotency key.
154   *
155   * <p>The idempotency key ensures that duplicate emails are not sent if the same key is used
156   * within a certain time window.
157   *
158   * @param request the request object containing email details and template variables
159   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate sends
160   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the email submission status
161   * @see #send(TransactionalSendRequest, String) for the synchronous variant
162   */
163  public CompletableFuture<TransactionalResponse> sendAsync(
164      TransactionalSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey) {
165    return sendAsync(request, idempotencyKey, RequestOptions.none());
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Asynchronously sends a transactional email with an idempotency key and custom request options.
170   *
171   * @param request the request object containing email details and template variables
172   * @param idempotencyKey optional idempotency key (max 100 characters) to prevent duplicate sends
173   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
174   * @return a CompletableFuture containing the email submission status
175   * @see #send(TransactionalSendRequest, String, RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
176   */
177  public CompletableFuture<TransactionalResponse> sendAsync(
178      TransactionalSendRequest request, String idempotencyKey, RequestOptions options) {
179    validateIdempotencyKey(idempotencyKey);
180
181    var generatedRequest = TransactionalMapper.toGenerated(request);
182    var optionsWithIdempotency = addIdempotencyKey(options, idempotencyKey);
183
184    return sender
185        .postJsonAsync(
186            TRANSACTIONAL_PATH,
187            generatedRequest,
188            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.TransactionalSuccessResponse.class,
189            optionsWithIdempotency)
190        .thenApply(TransactionalMapper::fromGenerated);
191  }
192
193  // ============================================================
194  // List Operations
195  // ============================================================
196
197  /**
198   * Lists all transactional emails.
199   *
200   * <p>This method uses default pagination settings and request options.
201   *
202   * @return the response containing a list of transactional emails and pagination information
203   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
204   * @see #listAsync() for the asynchronous variant
205   */
206  public TransactionalListResponse list() {
207    return list(null, null, RequestOptions.none());
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Lists transactional emails with pagination parameters.
212   *
213   * @param perPage number of results per page (must be between 10 and 50)
214   * @param cursor pagination cursor from a previous response, or null for the first page
215   * @return the response containing a list of transactional emails and pagination information
216   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
217   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if perPage is not between 10 and 50
218   * @see #listAsync(Integer, String) for the asynchronous variant
219   */
220  public TransactionalListResponse list(Integer perPage, String cursor) {
221    return list(perPage, cursor, RequestOptions.none());
222  }
223
224  /**
225   * Lists transactional emails with pagination parameters and custom request options.
226   *
227   * @param perPage number of results per page (must be between 10 and 50)
228   * @param cursor pagination cursor from a previous response, or null for the first page
229   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
230   * @return the response containing a list of transactional emails and pagination information
231   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
232   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsValidationException if perPage is not between 10 and 50
233   * @see #listAsync(Integer, String, RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
234   */
235  public TransactionalListResponse list(Integer perPage, String cursor, RequestOptions options) {
236    validatePerPage(perPage);
237
238    Map<String, String> queryParams = new HashMap<>();
239    if (perPage != null) {
240      queryParams.put("perPage", String.valueOf(perPage));
241    }
242    if (cursor != null) {
243      queryParams.put("cursor", cursor);
244    }
245
246    var generatedResponse =
247        sender.get(
248            TRANSACTIONAL_PATH,
249            queryParams,
250            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ListTransactionalsResponse.class,
251            options);
252    return TransactionalMapper.fromGenerated(generatedResponse);
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Asynchronously lists all transactional emails.
257   *
258   * <p>This method uses default pagination settings and request options.
259   *
260   * @return a CompletableFuture containing a list of transactional emails and pagination
261   *     information
262   * @see #list() for the synchronous variant
263   */
264  public CompletableFuture<TransactionalListResponse> listAsync() {
265    return listAsync(null, null, RequestOptions.none());
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Asynchronously lists transactional emails with pagination parameters.
270   *
271   * @param perPage number of results per page (must be between 10 and 50)
272   * @param cursor pagination cursor from a previous response, or null for the first page
273   * @return a CompletableFuture containing a list of transactional emails and pagination
274   *     information
275   * @see #list(Integer, String) for the synchronous variant
276   */
277  public CompletableFuture<TransactionalListResponse> listAsync(Integer perPage, String cursor) {
278    return listAsync(perPage, cursor, RequestOptions.none());
279  }
280
281  /**
282   * Asynchronously lists transactional emails with pagination parameters and custom request
283   * options.
284   *
285   * @param perPage number of results per page (must be between 10 and 50)
286   * @param cursor pagination cursor from a previous response, or null for the first page
287   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
288   * @return a CompletableFuture containing a list of transactional emails and pagination
289   *     information
290   * @see #list(Integer, String, RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
291   */
292  public CompletableFuture<TransactionalListResponse> listAsync(
293      Integer perPage, String cursor, RequestOptions options) {
294    validatePerPage(perPage);
295
296    Map<String, String> queryParams = new HashMap<>();
297    if (perPage != null) {
298      queryParams.put("perPage", String.valueOf(perPage));
299    }
300    if (cursor != null) {
301      queryParams.put("cursor", cursor);
302    }
303
304    return sender
305        .getAsync(
306            TRANSACTIONAL_PATH,
307            queryParams,
308            com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.ListTransactionalsResponse.class,
309            options)
310        .thenApply(TransactionalMapper::fromGenerated);
311  }
312
313  // ============================================================
314  // Helper Methods
315  // ============================================================
316
317  private void validateIdempotencyKey(String idempotencyKey) {
318    if (idempotencyKey != null && idempotencyKey.length() > MAX_IDEMPOTENCY_KEY_LENGTH) {
319      throw new LoopsValidationException(
320          "Idempotency key must not exceed "
321              + MAX_IDEMPOTENCY_KEY_LENGTH
322              + " characters, got: "
323              + idempotencyKey.length());
324    }
325  }
326
327  private void validatePerPage(Integer perPage) {
328    if (perPage != null && (perPage < MIN_PER_PAGE || perPage > MAX_PER_PAGE)) {
329      throw new LoopsValidationException(
330          "perPage must be between " + MIN_PER_PAGE + " and " + MAX_PER_PAGE + ", got: " + perPage);
331    }
332  }
333
334  private RequestOptions addIdempotencyKey(RequestOptions options, String idempotencyKey) {
335    if (idempotencyKey == null) {
336      return options;
337    }
338
339    Map<String, String> headers = new HashMap<>(options.headers());
340    headers.put("Idempotency-Key", idempotencyKey);
341    return new RequestOptions(headers);
342  }
343}
